data.title: Catholic Charities of Santa Clara County
data.meta_description: Provide food housing assistance access to benefits senior and mental health services jobs immigration legal services refugee foster care financial literacy asset development prevent generational poverty through childhood development parenting after-school learning neighborhood development services.
data.meta_site_name: Catholic Charities of Santa Clara County
data.text:
We're excited to share that Musically Fed has delivered unused meals, produce, and dry goods from the Rolling Stones’ Hackney Diamonds ’24 Tour concert at Levi’s Stadium to our John XXIII location for seniors, the unhoused, formerly incarcerated, and veterans in San Jose.

Thanks to this donation, we can provide additional nutritious meals and food to those in need and positively impact our community.

Congratulations to Our 2024 Golf Tournament Winners!

We're thrilled to celebrate our 2024 Golf Tournament winners and thank our Grand Marshal, Brian Baer, for his dedication and community support. We also want to express our gratitude to our sponsors and supporters.

Join us next at the Bocce Tournament on October 3rd at Campo di Bocce! Sponsorship opportunities are available.

Catholic Charities of Santa Clara County, Bridges of Hope Faith-Based Reentry, has been awarded the Counties Behavioral Health Hero award in May!

Bridges of Hope provides trauma-informed, client-centered, culturally appropriate services through case management, addressing barriers to self-sufficiency. We first greet people at the jail when they are released and direct them to reentry. Once referred and enrolled with Bridges of Hope, services consist of an assessment, development of a wellness service plan, linkage to mental health, primary health, substance use treatment, shelter, transitional housing, and basic needs like food, hygiene, transportation, cell phone connection and a place to receive mail. We provide work clothes, assist with union dues, tattoo removal, anger management, certificate programs, education, and employment through Catholic Charities Right Directions, as well as furniture, bedding, and rental assistance once a person is ready for permanent housing.

We attend court appointments and reconnect parents with their children. Our collaborative care model and diverse, multidisciplinary team of service navigators and case managers are essential to our integrated approach throughout Catholic Charities and the community. For more info ccscc.org/bridges-of-hope
